chapter.title: Generic Interface
chapter.para: The OTRS Generic Interface consist on a multiple layer framework that let OTRS communicate with other systems via a web service. this communication could be in two different ways:

listitem.para: OTRS as Provider: OTRS acts as a server listening request from the External System, processing the information, performing the requested action, and answering the request.
OTRS as Requester: OTRS acts as a client collecting information, and sending the petition to the Remote System and waiting for the response.

section.title: Web Services
section.para: A Web Service is a communication method between two systems, in our case OTRS and a Remote System.

The hart of the Web Service is it configuration, where is defined what actions does the web service can do internally (Operation), what can actions can OTRS request to the Remote System (Invokers), how data is converted from one system to the other (Mapping), And over which protocol the communication will be based on (Transport)

Generic Interface is the framework that make possible to create Web Services for OTRS in an already defined way, using already made construction blocks that are independent from each other and interchangeable.
